business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open higher driven by a rally in IT sector stocks; Infosys gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 246.41 points to 76,084.77, while the NSE Nifty50 added 62.15 points to 23,086.80 as of 9:26 AM.
HDFC Bank to announce Q3 results today: Here's what to expectHDFC Bank Q3 FY25: Investors will be keeping a keen eye on the results as the stock of HDFC Bank has fallen 8.62% in the last month.

Focus on effective spending, not tax cuts: Raghuram Rajan ahead of Budget 2025Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that he is not worried about the reduction in tax rates but instead about the need for more effective government spending, particularly in human capital development.

Stocks to watch today: HCLTech, HDFC Bank, HUL, Tata Communication, ZomatoHDFC Bank, Hindustan Unilever (HUL), and Tata Communication will be announcing their Q3 FY25 results today, hence their stocks will likely see some action.

Ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan speaks on Trump's tariffs, job creation and othersFormer RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan highlighted his views on issues like US President Donald Trump's plans to impose tariffs on some countries, including India, and how the economy and job creation is progressing under the Narendra Modi-led central government.

Concern for world won't benefit US much: Raghuram Rajan on Trump tariff threatSpeaking to India Today TV, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan warned that US President Donald Trump's tariff plans could harm global economic stability, increase costs, and deter foreign investment.
A decade of budget evolution under ModiCoalition dynamics could influence future budgetary decisions, particularly in the welfare sector. Will the government maintain its current priorities?

What to expect from Budget 2025: Growth, taxes, and fiscal realities in numbersFY25's deficit is projected at 4.9 per cent of the GDP, or Rs 16.1 trillion. Despite slower economic growth, the government is expected to stick to its fiscal discipline plan.

IMF's Gita Gopinath on Trump tariffs, impact on global growth, AI and moreDuring the interview, Gita Gopinath discussed the potential impact of US President Donald Trump's plan to impose new trade tariffs, global growth, bilateral trade between India and America, cryptocurrency and more.

IMF's Gita Gopinath suggests India to lower tariffs and focus on domestic reformsGita Gopinath suggested that India should consider lowering its tariffs, not only to counter the tariff concerns raised by former US President Donald Trump, but also to boost its own economic growth.

Sensex, Nifty crash: Bears dominate amid Trump's tariff threat; Zomato down 11%Share Market Crash: The S&P BSE Sensex plunged 1235.08 points to close at 75,838.36, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 320.10 points to end at 23,024.65.

Sensex crashes as Trump 2.0 spooks D-Street investors. 3 things to knowStock market crash: The Sensex tumbled 1,300 points to 75,773 at around 2:45 pm, while the Nifty50 fell below 23,000. All other broader market indices also collapsed during the trading session.

India could afford to cut back...: IMF's Gita Gopinath on Trump tariff threatGita Gopinath said that India's focus should be on domestic reforms rather than tariff battles as it looks to become a global hub for manufacturing.

Anshuman Mishra shares insights on Donald Trump's second term inaugurationInvestment banker and political strategist Anshuman Mishra provides exclusive insights from Washington DC on Donald Trump's second term inauguration.

Donald Trump's uncertain tariff plan keeps Dalal Street on edge. 3 key takeawaysUS President Donald Trump has decided not to immediately implement tariffs, leading to uncertainty among market investors around the world, including Dalal Street.

Adar Poonawalla shares his views on 70-hour workweek debateCEO of Serum Institute of India, Adar Poonawalla, shared his views on the ongoing debate about the 70-hour workweek, stating that human beings can not be productive after continuously working for 8-9 hours.

Adar Poonawalla on 70-hour workweek: Humans can't be productive beyond 8-9 hoursThe CEO of Serum Institute mentioned that there's no substitute for hard work but the quality of work, and working strategically is of importance.

Explained: Why Paytm share price fell 7% today and what's nextPaytm stock price: The drop in Paytm's share price came after the company reported its Q3FY25 results. Read to find out how brokerages rated Paytm's Q3 results and how the company's stock will perform in future.

Narayana Murthy clarifies 70-hour workweek remark: It's not wrong but is a choiceAfter stirring up a fierce debate on social media, Narayana Murthy has now suggested that the 70-hour workweek is a personal choice and should not be imposed on others.

Sensex tumbles over 800 points. Is Trump 2.0 behind stock market bloodbath?Stock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex was trading 800.18 points lower at 76,281 at 11:12 am, while the NSE Nifty50 dipped 200 points to 23,144.75.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: We need great people to come to US: Trump weighs in on H-1B visa debateWhen asked about the H-1B visa debate at a press conference on Tuesday, President Trump said that "I like both sides of the argument, but I also like very competent people coming into our country, even if that involves them training and helping other people that may not have the qualifications they do".

S Jaishankar attends Quad meet, Trump 2.0's first; bilateral with Rubio, his firstExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar participated in the Quad Foreign Ministers' meeting in Washington DC and highlighted the significance of the event as it was held a day after Donald Trump's inauguration as 47th US President.

Have mercy in name of God: Bishop appeals to Trump for LGBTQ+ members, immigrantsShortly after he took office, Trump announced that he would bring sweeping changes to the "gender identity" policy and also signed an executive order to launch an immediate crackdown on illegal immigration.

Saif Ali Khan's security guards were asleep when attacker entered house: CopsThe Mumbai Police said that both the security guards of the building where Saif Ali Khan resides were asleep when the attacker entered the building by scaling the compound wall.

Nita Ambani flaunts ethnic glam in traditional sarees at Trump's inauguration eventsMukesh and Nita Ambani attended Donald Trump's Inauguration Day ceremonies in Washington, where the latter proudly showcased her Indian heritage through her sartorial choices.

Day 11 Live Updates: Swiatek wins Set 1 over Navarro, Madison Keys beats Elina SvitolinaAustralian Open Day 11 Live Updates: Iga Swiatek has started off her quarter final clash with rather dominance after winning Set 1 with ease. Earlier, Madison Keys completed a comeback win over Elina Svitolina in the Women's singles quarterfinal to go through to the semi-final. The likes of Jannik Sinner, and Ben Shelton and Lorenzo to take the stage later in the day.

Trump places all federal diversity, equity, inclusion staff on paid leaveThe memo follows an executive order Trump signed on his first day ordering a sweeping dismantling of the federal government's diversity and inclusion programs that could touch on everything from anti-bias training to funding for minority farmers and homeowners.

Focus on effective spending, not tax cuts: Raghuram Rajan ahead of Budget 2025Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that he is not worried about the reduction in tax rates but instead about the need for more effective government spending, particularly in human capital development.

1st T20I, Predicted XI: Will dew affect India's team combination in Kolkata?India vs England, 1st T20I: India are set to kick off their T20I series against England on Wednesday in Kolkata. With dew expected to fall during the second half of the match, team selection will be crucial for both teams.

Zeenat Aman says she almost choked on tablet: Made frantic calls, son rushed overActor Zeenat Aman recently spoke about a scary experience when she choked on her tablets. She explained her ordeal and shared a life lesson she learnt from the incident.

Pataudi family may lose property worth Rs 15,000 crore after court orderOn December 13, 2024, the Madhya Pradesh High Court asked the Pataudi family to present their side before the appellate authority in 30 days. As of January 21, however, it was not clear whether the family did so.

Must not harass people, take law into hands: High Court fines ED Rs 1 lakhThe Bombay High Court slapped a fine of Rs 1 lakh on the ED for initiating a money laundering probe against a real estate developer "without serious application of mind" and said such agencies should act within the purview of law.

Kids up till 1 am, Novak Djokovic interrupts interview for daddy duty Australian Open 2025: Novak Djokovic entertained on the court and off it on Tuesday, putting on a show against third seed Carlos Alcaraz. The Serb interrupted his on-court interview to have a heartwarming chat with his kids, who were at Rod Laver Arena.

Why Chandrababu Naidu is likely to ignore calls to elevate Nara LokeshAmidst calls for Nara Lokesh to be elevated as Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister, the dynamics within the TDP-led coalition government, which is carefully balanced by Jana Sena Chief Pawan Kalyan's pivotal role, could face potential disruption.

Concern for world won't benefit US much: Raghuram Rajan on Trump tariff threatSpeaking to India Today TV, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan warned that US President Donald Trump's tariff plans could harm global economic stability, increase costs, and deter foreign investment.
Fact Check: Was Jaishankar asked to move to the back during Trump's inauguration?The full video makes it clear that the woman asked a cameraperson to move to the back, not S Jaishankar.

Kajal Aggarwal's shout-out to Coldplay-Jasleen Royal collab at Mumbai concertKajal Aggarwal and her husband, Gautam Kitchlu, attended Day 3 of Coldplay's Mumbai concert. The actor gave a shout-out to the collaboration of Coldplay and Jasleen Royal.

Shami, Gambhir-McCullum tussle in focus in battle of powerhousesIndia vs England 1st T20I: India will be keen to see returning pacer Mohammed Shami's fitness when a power-packed India take on a dynamic England in the first T20I at the high-scoring Eden Gardens.

Trump threatens Brics nations again with 100% tariffs over de-dollarisationConsidered an alternative to the West or the G7 bloc, the intergovernmental organisation consisting Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa, Egypt, Ethiopia, Indonesia, Iran, and the United Arab Emirates, has been looking at how to better trade among each other by using local currencies.

Turkey ski resort fire kills 76, minister says 'our hearts broken'The death toll in the fire that broke out at a 12-story hotel at a popular ski resort in northwestern Turkey rose to 76, with Interior Minister Ali Yerlikaya, saying, "our hearts and broken and "we are in mourning".

Brazil drought sparks surge in global coffee pricesExtreme heat and prolonged drought in Brazil's coffee-growing regions have slashed yields and sent arabica prices soaring to their highest in nearly 50 years. From struggling organic farms to scorched plantations, the crisis is rippling across global markets, making coffee a costly luxury for consumers worldwide.

US deploys assets to 'Gulf of America', other waterways after Trump's orderThe US maritime law enforcement agency will be increasing its presence in Florida to detect and prevent migrants from Haiti and Cuba. It will also increase focus on maritime borders in Hawaii and Alaska.

Press Lotus, see electricity vanish: Arvind Kejriwal warns voters against BJPFormer Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said that the city currently gets 24-hour electricity. He, however, warned voters against voting for the BJP, saying that electrcity would disappear if they pressed the Lotus button during Assembly elections.

Fur-ious revenge: Dog scratches car that hit it in Madhya PradeshA dog left scratches on a car that had hit it in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar in an unusual tale of revenge. A video of the incident also surfaced online.

Pushpa 2 box office Day 48: Allu Arjun film sees drop in numbers, earns Rs 55 lakhSix weeks after its release, Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2: The Rule witnessed a drop in its collection. The film has by far earned over Rs 1230 crore in India.

Kajal Aggarwal's shout-out to Coldplay-Jasleen Royal collab at Mumbai concertKajal Aggarwal and her husband, Gautam Kitchlu, attended Day 3 of Coldplay's Mumbai concert. The actor gave a shout-out to the collaboration of Coldplay and Jasleen Royal.

BB 18's Yamini Malhotra 'disheartened' by housing woes in Mumbai: It's shockingBigg Boss 18's Yamini Malhotra shared the struggles of finding a house in Mumbai. Elaborating on her woes in an Instagram post, she opened up about the challenges she's facing.

Ram Charan to take pay cut for producer Dil Raju's next after Game Changer runRam Charan is likely to do another film for producer Dil Raju with a lesser salary. This decision comes amid the middling theatrical run of the duo's recently released film, Game Changer, directed by Shankar.

sports.headline: India coach Gautam Gambhir visits Kalighat temple ahead of first T20I vs EnglandGautam Gambhir visited Kolkata's iconic Kalighat Kali Temple, seeking blessings before India's T20I series against England. With Mohammed Shami's return and Champions Trophy preparations in focus, India eyes redemption following their recent struggles against Australia.

Alex Hartley receives 'cold shoulder' from England after fitness commentAlex Hartley has disclosed being given the cold shoulder by England players during the Women's Ashes after criticising the team's fitness issues following their early T20 World Cup exit, raising questions about accountability in women's cricket.

Kohli, Rohit's form important for India to win in Dubai: KaifMohammad Kaif believes Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's experience and batting prowess will be crucial for India's success in the Champions Trophy, urging fans to trust their ability to bounce back from recent struggles and deliver on the big stage.

Liverpool, Barcelona into UCL last 16, Atletico stun LeverkusenBarcelona and Liverpool secured thrilling Champions League Round of 16 spots with dramatic victories, as Raphinha's late heroics sealed Barcelona's 5-4 win over Benfica, while Mohamed Salah's milestone goal led Liverpool to a hard-fought 2-1 triumph over Lille.

Carlos Alcaraz reveals biggest mistake in quarterfinal vs Novak DjokovicCarlos Alcaraz was knocked out of the Australian Open 2025 after losing to Novak Djokovic in the quarterfinal of the competition. Alcaraz reviewed his game and revealed his biggest mistake in the match.

Djokovic says beating Alcaraz 'huge win' for relationship with coach MurrayAustralian Open 2025: Novak Djokovic said his relationship with coach Andy Murray is getting better with every passing day and the win against Carlos Alcaraz in the quarterfinal will only help further the bond.

Australian Open: Murray consoles Carlos Alcaraz after loss vs Novak DjokovicNovak Djokovic's coach Andy Murray consoled young Carlos Alcaraz after the Spaniard was beaten in the quarter-finals of the Australian Open 2025. Alcaraz lost the quarters vs Djokovic despite winning the first set of the match.

2 arms, 1.5 legs: How Djokovic battled injury to beat Alcaraz Australian Open 2025: Novak Djokovic talked about how he dealt with his leg injury during the match against Carlos Alcaraz on Tuesday. Djokovic lost the opening set before he made a comeback to book a berth in the semi-final of the hard court major.

No question mark over Samson as wicketkeeper in T20I side: Suryakumar India captain Suryakumar Yadav confirmed that Sanju Samson is the first-choice wicketkeeper in the T20I side with Dhruv Jurel being his backup. "Currently, there is no question mark on the wicketkeeper," Suryakumar told the reporters.

Hardik Pandya part of leadership group: Suryakumar Yadav on vice-captaincy snubSuryakumar Yadav has stressed that all-rounder Hardik Pandya is firmly a part of the leadership group. The India T20I captain has revealed his relationship with Pandya after the all-rounder was snubbed from the vice-captain's position for the England series.

Ageless Novak Djokovic dumps out Carlos Alcaraz for special 50 Australian Open 2025: 24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic defeated third seed Carlos Alcaraz 4-6, 6-4, 6-3, 6-4 in the men's singles quarter-final to reach his 50th Grand Slam semi-final on Tuesday.

Champions Trophy: Karachi, Lahore stadiums face litmus Test in tri-seriesThe under-construction Karachi and Lahore stadiums will be handed to the Pakistan Cricket Board on 5 February, two weeks ahead of ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Pakistan will play a tri-series against South Africa and New Zealand in the renovated stadiums.

ICC boss Jay Shah meets Olympic Committee head Thomas Bach ahead of LA 2028International Cricket Council chief Jay Shah met the head of the International Olympic Committee, Thomas Bach. Shah met the IOC head in Switzerland, the images of which were released by the ICC.

Don't feel hurt by Champions Trophy exclusion: Suryakumar YadavSuryakumar Yadav addressed his exclusion from India's 15-member squad for the ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025. Suryakumar has not played an ODI for India since the 2023 World Cup final against Australia.

Manchester City sign 19-year-old Vitor Ries from Brazil's PalmeirasManchester City signed 19-year-old Vitor Reis from Palmeiras for 35 million euros, strengthening their squad with young talent. The Brazilian defender is part of Pep Guardiola's plan to build a future-ready team.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
